alert.note: Alert for Imperial County West; Imperial Valley; Salton Sea (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Wind Advisory issued February 22 at 12:17AM PST until February 22 at 9:00PM PST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...BLOWING DUST ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM THIS MORNING TO 7 PM PST THIS EVENING... ...WIND ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM THIS MORNING TO 9 PM PST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...For the Blowing Dust Advisory, visibility between one quarter mile and one mile in blowing dust expected. For the Wind Advisory, west winds 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 40 mph expected. * WHERE...Salton Sea, Western Imperial County and Imperial Valley. * WHEN...For the Blowing Dust Advisory, from 9 AM this morning to 7 PM PST this evening. For the Wind Advisory, from 9 AM this morning to 9 PM PST this evening. * IMPACTS...Hazardous driving conditions due to reduced visibility. Difficult driving conditions, especially for larger vehicles traveling along roads with crosswinds. Light, unsecured objects may become airborne.
info.instruction: Be ready for a sudden drop in visibility. If you encounter blowing dust or blowing sand on the roadway or see it approaching, pull off the road as far as possible and put your vehicle in park. Turn the lights all the way off and keep your foot off the brake pedal. Remember, pull aside, stay alive. A Wind Advisory means that sustained wind speeds of between 30 and 40 mph are expected, or wind gusts of between 40 and 58 mph. Winds this strong can make driving difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. In addition, strong winds over desert areas could result in briefly lowered visibilities to well under a mile at times in blowing dust or blowing sand. Use extra caution.

area.areaDesc: Imperial County West; Imperial Valley; Salton Sea
